dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Kicking us off today, big news out of Tesla, right? The FBI is apparently digging into their Model 3 production claims.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Kicking us off today, big news out of Tesla, right? The F B I is apparently digging into their Model three production claims.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Federal Bureau of Investigation is reviewing public statements by the Palo Alto, California-based company dating back to early 2017 to determine if it misled investors based on what it said regarding its ability to produce the Model 3, according to The Wall Street Journal, citing unnamed people familiar with the matter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, like, this goes way back to early 2017. They're looking into whether Tesla sort of, uh, rewarded investors based on what they *said* about Model 3 production.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like, this goes way back to early twenty seventeen. They're looking into whether Tesla sort of, uh, rewarded investors based on what they said about Model three production.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Federal Bureau of Investigation is reviewing public statements by the Palo Alto, California-based company dating back to early 2017 to determine if it misled investors based on what it said regarding its ability to produce the Model 3...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. And it's interesting because the Model 3 *did* impact Tesla's quarterly losses pretty hard, but then, Elon Musk himself, you know, they actually hit 5,000 Model 3s a week *six months faster* than *he* predicted.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. And it's interesting because the Model three did impact Tesla's quarterly losses pretty hard, but then, Elon Musk himself, you know, they actually hit five thousand Model three seconds a week six months faster than he predicted.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The companys better-than-expected quarterly profit was driven by that car, but it took half a year longer than CEO Elon Musk had predicted to reach a production pace of 5,000 Model 3s per week.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which is wild, because he initially said they'd hit that 5,000 a week target in late 2017. But then, uh, they kinda just went quiet about it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is wild, because he initially said they'd hit that five thousand a week target in late twenty seventeen. But then, uh, they kinda just went quiet about it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Musk had said early last year that production of Model 3, currently priced from $46,000, would reach 5,000 units per week in 2017s fourth quarter, and reiterated that target in July 2017 after production of it began in Fremont, California.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Totally. They only built like, 2,700 cars last year!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. They only built like, two thousand, seven hundred cars last year!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In fact, the company built only about 2,700 of the cars last year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly. So the FBI wants to know, were they *telling* people one thing, but *doing* another?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly. So the F B I wants to know, were they telling people one thing, but doing another?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And it's not just the FBI. Tesla's denying a mandatory document request from the DOJ, but they *did* admit to getting a subpoena and other formal requests.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's not just the F B I. Tesla's denying a mandatory document request from the D O J, but they did admit to getting a subpoena and other formal requests.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla confirmed in an e-mailed statement that earlier this year it received a voluntary request for documents from the Department of Justice about its public guidance for the Model 3 ramp and we were cooperative in responding to it. We have not received a subpoena, a request for testimony, or any other formal process...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, for sure. They've been getting those document requests from the Department of Justice for months, apparently.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, for sure. They've been getting those document requests from the Department of Justice for months, apparently.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...and there have been no additional document requests about this from the Department of Justice for months.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Speaking of investigations, remember the whole SEC thing with Musk's "going private" tweets? That actually slowed down *this* FBI investigation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Speaking of investigations, remember the whole S E C thing with Musk's going private tweets? That actually slowed down this F B I investigation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The pace of activity in the investigation, which is led by the U.S. attorneys office in San Francisco, intensified after Musk and Tesla settled a dispute with the Securities and Exchange Commission stemming from his tweets in August about taking Tesla private, the report said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] Yeah, 'cause everyone was focused on that. And the settlement there was pretty wild, right? Musk stepped down as chairman, paid 20 million...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, cause everyone was focused on that. And the settlement there was pretty wild, right? Musk stepped down as chairman, paid twenty million...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As part of a settlement concluded this month, Musk agreed to step down as Teslas chairman, a position he assumed long before becoming its CEO, and pay a $20 million fine to settle the matter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And Tesla coughed up another 20 mil, plus had to remove two independent directors. Stock took a dive after the quarterly results, too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Tesla coughed up another twenty mil, plus had to remove two independent directors. Stock took a dive after the quarterly results, too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla also must pay a further $20 million and add two independent directors to its board. Tesla shares surged 15%, or by $42.40, to $330.90 in the days following its surprise quarterly results.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But then, interestingly, it popped back up a little after the Wall Street Journal story broke.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then, interestingly, it popped back up a little after the Wall Street Journal story broke.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The stock was down less than 1% in after-hours trading following the WSJ story.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, how did Tesla defend all this? Their philosophy, they said, was to set "sandbagged targets." Not totally truthful, but not unrealistic either.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, how did Tesla defend all this? Their philosophy, they said, was to set sandbagged targets. Not totally truthful, but not unrealistic either.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla defended its past statements, and that its philosophy has always been to set truthful targets not sandbagged targets that we would definitely exceed and not unrealistic targets that we could never meet.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, like, they said they were silent about how "easy" it would be. They were kinda, um, downplaying it, but internally, they actually foresaw this success.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like, they said they were silent about how easy it would be. They were kinda, um, downplaying it, but internally, they actually foresaw this success.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Ultimately, given difficulties that we did not foresee in this first-of-its-kind production ramp, it took us six months longer than we expected to meet our 5,000 unit per week guidance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And they claim they hit that 5,000 units a week goal six months *sooner* than *their internal* expectations. It's, uh, a lot of moving parts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they claim they hit that five thousand units a week goal six months sooner than their internal expectations. It's, uh, a lot of moving parts.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Ultimately, given difficulties that we did not foresee in this first-of-its-kind production ramp, it took us six months longer than we expected to meet our 5,000 unit per week guidance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. A murky picture, that's for sure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. A murky picture, that's for sure.
